meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly or greedily.
meanings.sent1: He scarfed down his sandwich before heading to practice.
meanings.sent2: She always scarfed her favorite candy when watching movies.
meanings.sent3: The hungry dog scarfed the treat in one big gulp.
meanings.sent4: The students scarfed the pizza at the school party.
meanings.sent5: Scarfed cookies disappeared in seconds at the bake sale.

meanings.definition: A long, broad strip of wool, silk, lace, or other material worn about the neck, shoulders, or head, for ornament or protection.
meanings.sent1: She wore a colorful scarf to keep warm in the winter.
meanings.sent2: The elegant scarf matched her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: He wrapped the scarf around his head like a pirate.
meanings.sent4: The scarf fluttered in the wind as she walked along the beach.
meanings.sent5: The soft scarf felt cozy against her skin on chilly evenings.
